en.purpose: To estimate the patient-specific probability of experiencing a myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest within 30 days following surgery, based on clinical risk factors.
en.use: Use to record the required inputs and calculate the predicted cardiac risk for adult patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery. Helps identify low (<1%) vs. elevated (≥1%) risk and guide further evaluation or optimization.
en.misuse: Not for use in cardiac surgery, long-term cardiac risk prediction, or as a replacement for full clinical evaluation. Not validated in pediatric or emergency settings.

other_details.en: This guideline calculates the 30-day risk of myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest (MICA) following non-cardiac surgery using the logistic regression model developed by Gupta et al. It supports perioperative clinical decision-making based on five inputs: age, functional status, ASA class, serum creatinine, and type of surgery.
